description.p: While almost all wizards study in formal schools under the tutelage of a wise master, some wizards reject traditional arcane schooling and strike out into the world to learn by doing. These rare few who hone their craft out in the wilds are referred to as Hedge Wizards. Though their methods are frowned upon by formal wizarding schools, any archmage worthy of his station will reluctantly recognize that Hedge Wizards are the true masters of the low magics.

Regardless of their background, all Hedge Wizards reject the traditional methods of wizardry. When creating your Hedge Wizard consider how your spellcasting and spellbook may differ from a wizard who attended a formal school.

div.p: Your Arcane Conservation feature allows you to regain a spell slot when one of your spells fails. For the purposes of this ability, a failed spell is a spell that imposes no effects and deals no damage to the environment, creatures, or objects when cast. If a creature uses a Legendary Resistance to avoid a spell's effect, it does not count as a failed spell.

description.p: Your unorthodox relationship with arcane magic allows you to you learn fundamental magics not traditionally associated with wizards. When you adopt this Arcane Tradition at 2nd level, you learn one cantrip of your choice from any spell list. The chosen cantrip counts as a wizard spell for you, but does not count against your total number of Cantrips Known.
You learn additional cantrips in this way as you gain levels in this class; one each at 6th level, 10th level, and 14th level.

Your deep understanding of the low magics allows you to add them to your spellbook at a discount. Starting at 2nd level, the time you must spend to copy any spell of a level equal to half your proficiency bonus or lower into your spellbook is halved, and the cost of the materials and inks is reduced by 50 gold.

sheet.description: The time you must spend to copy any spell of level {{proficiency:half}} or lower into your spellbook is halved, and the cost of the materials and inks is reduced by 50 gold.

element.name: On the Fly

description.p: Your skill with basic magic is second to none, allowing you to spontaneously cast low-level spells that you haven't prepared. Beginning at 6th level, you can use your action to cast any spell of 2nd-level or lower from your spellbook, even if you don't have the spell prepared, expending the appropriate spell slot. The spell must have a casting time of one action.
You can cast a spell in this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
As you gain levels in this class, you can cast more powerful spells with this feature: 3rd-level spells at 10th level, 4th-level spells at 14th level, and finally 5th-level spells at 18th level.

element.sheet: You cast any spell of level {{on-the-fly:spell-level}} or lower from your spellbook, if if you don't have it prepared.

description.p: Learning your magic out in the wild instead of the controlled environment of a formal school has made you hardier than most wizards. Starting at 10th level, when you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you can use a reaction to grant yourself a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
You can use this reaction after you roll, but before you determine whether you succeed or fail.

sheet.description: When you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you can grant yourself a +{{int-mod:min-one}} bonus to the roll.

description.p: Your understanding of arcane fundamentals allows you to recycle the energy of failed spells. Beginning at 14th level, when you cast a wizard spell of 4th-level or lower and the spell fails, you regain one expended spell slot. The spell slot regained must be a lower level than the spell slot used to cast the failed spell. This feature applies to all spells of 4th-level or lower, even if they are cast with a higher level spell slot.
When you reach 18th level in this class, this ability affects any wizard spells of 5th-level and lower.

sheet.description: When you cast a wizard spell of {{arcane-conservation:spell-level}}th-level or lower and the spell fails, you regain one expended spell slot. The spell slot regained must be a lower level than the spell slot used to cast the failed spell. This feature applies to all spells of {{arcane-conservation:spell-level}}th-level or lower, even if they are cast with a higher level spell slot.

description.p: Wizards spend their lives memorizing esoteric formulas that allow them to produce wondrous arcane effects. However, when produced spontaneously, spells are extremely taxing on the caster. To preserve their power, most wizards learn to cast ritual spells, spells that take longer to produce, but aren't as draining on a wizard's magical stamina. Some wizards, known as Ritualists, dedicate their lives to mastering the deliberate and reliable magic of ritual spellcasting.

div.p: While all wizards rely on spell scrolls, Ritualists are known for going to great lengths to expand their spellbooks, especially looking to add new rituals.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy a ritual spell into your spellbook is halved.

sheet.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a ritual spell into your spellbook is halved.

description.p: You have learned to perform arcane rituals not normally known to wizards. At 2nd level, you add two 1st-level ritual spells of your choice from any spell list to your spellbook. In addition, you can copy ritual spells from any class's spell list into your spellbook, though you must otherwise follow the normal rules for copying these spells into your spellbook.
Any non-wizard spell you add to your spellbook with this feature counts as wizard spell for you, but you can only cast it as a ritual, unless you've learned it by some other means.

sheet.description: You can copy ritual spells from any class's spell list into your spellbook, though you must otherwise follow the normal rules for copying these spells into your spellbook. Any non-wizard spell you add to your spellbook with this feature counts as wizard spell for you, but you can only cast it as a ritual, unless you've learned it by some other means.

description.p: You can accelerate the ritual process for spells with which you are exceptionally familiar. Beginning at 6th level, you can cast the ritual version of any 1st-level spell from your spellbook without the additional 10 minute casting time.
You can accelerate a ritual spell in this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
As you gain levels in this class, you learn to accelerate higher-level ritual spells: 2nd-level rituals at 10th level, 3rd-level rituals at 14th level, and 4th-level rituals at 18th level.

sheet.description: You can cast the ritual version of any {{accelerated-rituals:spell-level}}-level spell from your spellbook without the additional 10 minute casting time.

description.p: Your deep knowledge of ritual magic allows you to ritualize even non-ritual spells. Starting at 10th level, you can cast any 1st-level spell in your spellbook as a ritual so long as it doesn't deal damage or require a saving throw.
As you gain levels in this class you learn to ritualize higher level spells that don't deal damage or require a saving throw; 2nd-level spells at 14th level, and 3rd-level spells at 18th level.

sheet.description: You can cast any 1st-level spell in your spellbook as a ritual so long as it doesn't deal damage or require a saving throw.

description.p: You have reached an unparalleled understanding of ritualistic magic and its applications. Beginning at 14th level, you can concentrate on the effects of up to two ritual spells at once.

The total levels of the spells you concentrate on cannot exceed your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1st-level), and when you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on your spells, you make one saving throw for both concentration effects.
In addition, whenever you cast the ritual version of a spell that has a duration longer than instantaneous, the duration of the spell's effect is doubled.

sheet.description: You can concentrate on the effects of up to two ritual spells at once. The total levels of the spells you concentrate on cannot exceed {{int-mod:min-one}}, and when you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on your spells, you make one saving throw for both concentration effects. In addition, whenever you cast the ritual version of a spell that has a duration longer than instantaneous, the duration of the spell's effect is doubled.

description.p: While most scholars of the arcane arts pursue metaphysical power, some focus their study on more concrete applications of magic. Wizards that join the School of Biomancy combine powerful transmutation and necromancy magic to alter and enhance their own physical forms. These strange mages are masters of manipulating the organic matter that makes up all living things, and they do not hesitate to make evolutionary adjustments to themselves, or those who travel with them.

Beginning at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy any Biomancy spell into your spellbook is halved. Also, each time you gain a level in this class, you can choose to add one or more Biomancy spells to your spellbook.
In addition, the spells in the Biomancy Spells table below count as wizard spells for you, and are considered Biomancy spells in addition to their normal school of magic.

sheet.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy any Biomancy spell into your spellbook is halved. Also, each time you gain a level in this class, you can choose to add one or more Biomancy spells to your spellbook.

description.p: You can use the magic of Biomancy to create life. At 2nd level, you add the find familiar spell to your spellbook, and when you cast find familiar it has the following changes:

ul.li: The material component is 1 pound of organic matter.
It is a monstrosity (instead of a celestial, fey, or fiend).
It has additional hit points equal to your wizard level.

description.p: In addition, your familiar can heal others by grafting its own flesh onto the creature's wounds. As an action, your familiar can sacrifice any amount of its hit points, touching a willing creature and healing them for the same amount.

sheet.description: When you cast find familiar it has the following changes: The material component is 1 pound of organic matter. It is a monstrosity. It has {{level:wizard}} additional hit points. As an action, your familiar can sacrifice any amount of its hit points, touching a willing creature and healing them for the same amount.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you use your knowledge of Biomancy to enhance your own physical form. At the end of each long rest, choose one of the body modifications listed below, the benefits of which last until the end of your next long rest.
Amphibious Physiology. You develop gills and webbing between your digits. You can breathe both air and water, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your movement speed.
Resilient Hide. Your flesh becomes thick and knotted. While not wearing any armor, your Armor Class is equal to 10 + your Intelligence modifier + your Constitution modifier.

Vestigial Limb. You grow an additional limb resembling a smaller version of your other limbs. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to your Intellignece score. The limb cannot use weapons or shields nor can it do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools.

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, choose one of the following body modifications, the benefits of which last until the end of your next long rest. Amphibious Physiology, Resilient Hide, or Vestigial Limb.

description.p: Your magic enhances the life force of other creatures. Starting at 10th level, when you target a creature with a Biomancy spell, or your Enhanced Familiar heals a creature, you can grant the creature temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

sheet.description: When you target a creature with a Biomancy spell, or your Enhanced Familiar heals a creature, you can grant the creature {{int-mod:min-one}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, your familiar can graft itself onto a willing creature as an action, granting them temporary hit points equal to its remaining hit points. The creature then gains a Modular Biology modification of your choice, which lasts until their temporary hit points are depleted.
Casting find familiar again while this ability is active causes any temporary hit points to immediately dispel.

sheet.description: Your familiar can graft itself onto a willing creature as an action, granting them temporary hit points equal to its remaining hit points. The creature then gains a Modular Biology modification of your choice, which lasts until their temporary hit points are depleted.

description.p: Considered by many scholars to be the ninth school of magic, Chronomancy, the magic of time, is only studied by a rare few. Usually, magic that affects the flow of time is forbidden. If a Chronomancer outwardly announces their focus on this magic they often bring unintended consequences down on themselves in the form of inquisitors seeking to prevent the catastrophe that comes with changing the flow of time.

Beginning at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy any Chronomancy spell into your spellbook is halved. Also, each time you gain a level in this class, you can choose to add one or more Chronomancy spells to your spellbook.
In addition, the spells in the Chronomancy Spells table below count as wizard spells for you, and are considered Chronomancy spells in addition to their school of magic.

sheet.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy any Chronomancy spell into your spellbook is halved. Also, each time you gain a level in this class, you can choose to add one or more Chronomancy spells to your spellbook.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can see echoes of past events in the present. Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check while you are in the location where the event took place, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.

Your unique perspective on the flow of time is also source of guidance and insight. At 2nd level you learn the guidance cantrip, which counts as a wizard spell for you, but it doesn't count against your total number of Cantrips Known.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an History check while you are in the location where the event took place, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.

description.p: You have gained the ability manipulate the flow of time for creatures around you, if only for a moment. Starting at 6th level, when you roll initiative and are not surprised, you can force a creature of your choice within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, your initiatives are switched for the duration of that combat ecounter.
A friendly creature can willingly fail their saving throw.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative and are not surprised, you can force a creature of your choice within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, your initiatives are switched for the duration of that combat ecounter. A friendly creature can willingly fail their saving throw.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, your mastery over the flow of time allows you to borrow arcane power from your future self. As a bonus action on your turn, you can draw a spell slot from a future version of yourself to recover one of your expended spell slots of 5th-level or lower.

You can draw a maximum number of spell slots through this ability with a combined level equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). At the end of a short or long rest, you can complete a brief ritual where you expend spell slots that you drew from your future self, regaining expended uses of this feature equal to the level of the spell slots you expend.

sheet.description: You can draw a spell slot from a future version of yourself to recover one of your expended spell slots of 5th-level or lower. You can draw a maximum number of spell slots through this ability with a combined level equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). At the end of a short or long rest, you can complete a brief ritual where you expend spell slots that you drew from your future self, regaining expended uses of this feature equal to the level of the spell slots you expend.

description.p: Your mastery over the magic of time rivals the most powerful creatures of the multiverse. Starting at 14th level, you can use your power to undo events in time. When a creature within 60 feet of you ends its turn, you can use your reaction to undo anything that occurred during that creature's turn. The target immediately returns to the space it began its turn, regains any expended spell slots or abilities, and any effects of their actions are undone. The creature immediately repeats its turn, with everyone aware of its previous course of action.
Once you use this reaction to rewind time, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you expend a spell slot of 6th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

sheet.description: When a creature within 60 feet of you ends its turn, you can use your reaction to undo anything that occurred during that creature's turn. The target immediately returns to the space it began its turn, regains any expended spell slots or abilities, and any effects of their actions are undone. The creature immediately repeats its turn, with everyone aware of its previous course of action.

description.p: Though considered barbaric by most wizards, Hemomancy, also known as blood magic, is one of the most powerful and ancient Arcane Traditions. Discovered in ages long forgotten by priests of dark gods, Hemomancers use the power of their own lifeblood to work sinister spells of overwhelming power.

div.p: The School of Hemomancy has the potential for great power, but at great risk. Any reduction to the already low maximum hit points of a wizard is dangerous, and reducing your maximum hit points to 0 causes you to immediately die. This Arcane Tradition is not recommended for beginner players.

description.p: You have begun to study the ancient and powerful magic of Hemomancy. When you adopt this Arcane Tradition at 2nd level, you learn to sacrifice your own lifeblood to cast spells. As a bonus action, you can regain an expended spell slot by reducing your maximum hit points by an amount equal to twice the level of the spell slot you wish to regain. You can create spell slots no higher than 5th-level with this ability.

At the end of each long rest, if your maximum hit points have been reduced by one of your Hemomamcy features, you reduce that reduction by 1. You can also expend Hit Dice, regaining maximum hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) for each Hit Die you expend.

sheet.description: You can regain an expended spell slot (up to 5th-level) by reducing your maximum hit points by an amount equal to twice the level of the spell slot you wish to regain. At the end of each long rest, if your maximum hit points have been reduced by one of your Hemomamcy features, you reduce that reduction by 1. You can also expend Hit Dice, regaining {{con-mod:min-one}} for each Hit Die you expend.

description.p: Beginning at 2nd level, when you copy a spell into your spellbook, you can write the spell in your blood instead of expending the normal gold and ink. For each level of the spell you are copying, your maximum hit points are reduced by 1.

sheet.description: When you copy a spell into your spellbook, you can write the spell in your blood instead of expending the normal gold and ink. For each level of the spell you are copying, your maximum hit points are reduced by 1.

description.p: You can use dark Hemomancy techniques to drain the life from others. Starting at 6th level, when you deal poison or necrotic damage to a creature, you can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you deal poison or necrotic damage to a creature, you can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

description.p: Your mastery of blood magic has fortified your body. At 10th level you gain resistance to necrotic and poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against poison.
Your magic also allows you to regenerate more quickly. At the end of each long rest, you regain additional expended Hit Dice equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison. At the end of each long rest, you regain {{con-mod:min-one}} additional expended Hit Dice.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can increase the power of spells that drain the life force of other creatures. When you cast a spell that deals poison or necrotic damage, that is not a cantrip, you can choose to deal maximum damage.

The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, your maximum hit points are immediately reduced by an amount equal to twice the level at which you cast the spell.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell that deals poison or necrotic damage, that is not a cantrip, you can choose to deal maximum damage. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, your maximum hit points are immediately reduced by an amount equal to twice the level at which you cast the spell.

description.p: Some who study the arcane aren't satisfied with traditional schools of wizardry and turn to the dark arts in their hunger for power. Striking out into the wild, they seek out beings from the lower planes, creatures from the Shadowfell, or vile covens of hags in order to learn otherworldly eldritch magic.
Many who follow this path are willing to sacrifice anything, even their eternal soul, in order to learn sinister magics often reserved for those who enter pacts with eldritch entities.

div.p: The School of Hexcraft grants wizards access to specific Eldritch Invocations from the warlock class. Consider granting a Hexcraft wizard access to more powerful Invocations in addition to their normal treasure, magic items, and other rewards.

description.p: When you adopt this Arcane Tradition at 2nd level, you gain access to magic that is shunned by all by the most unhinged. You can copy warlock spells that you find in other spellbooks or spell scrolls into your spellbook. Warlock spells gained through this feature count as wizard spells for you.
Also, when you gain a level in this class, one of the spells you add to your spellbook must be from the warlock spell list.

sheet.description: You can copy warlock spells that you find in other spellbooks or spell scrolls into your spellbook. Warlock spells gained through this feature count as wizard spells for you. Also, when you gain a level in this class, one of the spells you add to your spellbook must be from the warlock spell list.

description.p: In your study of dark magics you have gained for yourself strange and sinister abilities. At 2nd level, you learn of two Eldritch Invocations of your choice from the list below.
When you gain a level in this class, you can switch your Invocation for another of your choice from the list below.
You learn an additional Eldritch Invocation from this list when you reach 6th, 10th, and 14th level in this class.
Beast Speech. You can cast speak with animals at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
Beguiling Influence. You gain proficiency in both the Deception and Persuasion skills.
Devil's Sight. You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.
Eldritch Sight. You can cast detect magic, at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
Eyes of the Rune Keeper. You can read and understand all written symbols and writing.
Misty Visions. You can cast silent image at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
One with Shadows. When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become invisible until you move or take an action or a reaction.

You can use your knowledge of dark magic to enhance your life force at the cost of your surroundings. Beginning at 6th level, when you finish casting a ritual spell, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to the level at which you cast the ritual spell + your wizard level. When you complete a ritual in this way, the flora and fauna around you becomes noticeably withered and sickly, and delicate life dies.

sheet.description: When you finish casting a ritual spell, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to the level at which you cast the ritual spell + {{level:wizard}}.

description.p: Your familiarity with forbidden things allows you to hide yourself from the prying eyes of spellcasters and other powerful creatures. Starting at 10th level, you are immune to any effect that would sense your emotions, read your thoughts, or detect your alignment, as well as any divination spell that you refuse. Additionally, when a creature makes a Wisdom (Insight) check to ascertain your true intentions or sincerity they do so at disadvantage.

sheet.description: You are immune to any effect that would sense your emotions, read your thoughts, or detect your alignment, as well as any divination spell that you refuse. Additionally, when a creature makes a Insight check to ascertain your true intentions or sincerity they do so at disadvantage.

description.p: You have learned the sinister magic of drawing power from death. Beginning at 14th level, when you kill a creature with a spell of 1st-level or higher, you can use your reaction to regain one of your expended spell slots. The recoverd spell slot must be of a level lower then the spell cast to kill the creature, and you cannot be higher than 5th-level.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.

sheet.description: When you kill a creature with a spell of 1st-level or higher, you can regain one of your expended spell slots. The recoverd spell slot must be of a level lower then the spell cast to kill the creature, and you cannot be higher than 5th-level.

description.p: Originally developed by dwarves, the School of Metallurgy emphasizes order, organization, and community. Known as Metallurgists, wizards who belong to this Arcane Tradition use their magic to impose order on a disordered world.

Masters of powerful abjuration and transmutation magic, Metallurgists wield an arcane alloy known as Arcanometal to great effect. Mages of this School are almost always Lawful in their outlook. Some seek to do the most good for the most people, while others use force to impose order on the world.
When you adopt this Arcane Tradition at 2nd level, you are taught the secret ritual that Metallurgists use to synthesize Arcanometal, the signature alloy of the School of Metallurgy.

You can synthesize gold into liquid Arcanometal that you use to copy spells into your spellbook. For each level of the spell you wish to add to your spellbook, you must expend 70 gold to create the liquid Arcanometal to copy the spell. Any spell copied in this way is known as an Arcanometal Spell.
When you cast an Arcanometal spell, you can choose for the spell to deal force damage in place of its normal damage.
You can change the damage of a spell in this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can synthesize gold into liquid Arcanometal that you use to copy spells into your spellbook. For each level of the spell you wish to add to your spellbook, you must expend 70 gold to create the liquid Arcanometal to copy the spell. Any spell copied in this way is known as an Arcanometal Spell. When you cast an Arcanometal spell, you can choose for the spell to deal force damage in place of its normal damage. You can change the damage this way {{int-mod:min-one}} times per long rest.

You can synthesize gold into liquid Arcanometal that you use to copy spells into your spellbook. For each level of the spell you wish to add to your spellbook, you must expend 70 gold to create the liquid Arcanometal to copy the spell. Any spell copied in this way is known as an Arcanometal Spell. When you cast an Arcanometal spell, you can choose for the spell to deal force damage in place of its normal damage.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can create simple Arcanometal items. You conduct an hour-long ritual that crafts a Small or Tiny item made only of metal. The creation is completed at the end of the hour-long ritual, with the item appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of you. The Arcanometal object you create is visibly magical.

The object you create must be worth less than 100 gold. As part of this ritual, you must lay out metal, which can include coins, with a value equal to the creation. The metal irretrievably coalesces and transforms into the creation at the ritual’s end. In place of providing metal or coins, you can instead expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You conduct an hour-long ritual that crafts a Small or Tiny item made only of metal. The object you create must be worth less than {{metallurgist:gp-limit}} gold.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast an Arcanometal Spell, you can siphon off a small amount of energy to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to twice the level of the spell slot you expended to cast the spell. While you have temporary hit points from this ability, you are resistant to all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Temporary hit points gained from this ability last until the end of your next long rest, or until you gain temporary hit points from another source.

sheet.description: When you cast an Arcanometal Spell, you can siphon off a small amount of energy to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to twice the level of the spell slot you expended to cast the spell. While you have temporary hit points from this ability, you are resistant to all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Temporary hit points gained from this ability last until the end of your next long rest, or until you gain temporary hit points from another source.

description.p: You wield Arcanometal as an artist wields their medium of choice. Starting at 10th level, you can use your Metallurgist feature to create objects worth up to 1000 gold.
In addition, when you use your Metallurgist feature you can create larger metal objects, expending a higher-level spell slot depending on the size as indicated in the table below:

sheet.description: When you use your Metallurgist feature you can create larger metal objects, expending a higher-level spell slot depending on the size: 3rd > Medium, 5th > Large, 7th > Huge, 9th > Gargantuan

description.p: Your Arcanometal is a conduit for your overwhelming arcane power. Starting at 14th level, when you have temporary hit points from your Arcanometal Shield, you gain resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
In addition, you can use Arcanometal Adept to deal force damage with your Arcanometal Spells without limit.

sheet.description: When you have temporary hit points from your Arcanometal Shield, you gain resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
